oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Purchase by United States from Alexander Fall, dealer in hardware and cutlery

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; United States -- Army -- Supplies and stores; United States -- Army -- Quartermaster Corps
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One-page list of December 1864 hardware purchases by the United States through its Quartermaster's Department from the Alexander Fall business of Nashville. Pencil checks and notations added to the purchase order reveal the careful scrutiny of Assistant Quartermaster William Alonzo Wainwright as he detects errors and endeavors to balance accounts.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Alexander Fall, Nashville (Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: William Alonzo Wainwright, United States Assistant Quartermaster Records, 1861-1870
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Nashville Quartermaster Depot was established as a new advance depot in the winter of 1863, joining depots at St. Louis and Louisville to supply the western campaign theater. William Alonzo Wainwright was promoted from Regimental Quartermaster to the rank of captain and Assistant Quartermaster in the Engineering Department at the Nashville Depot in December of 1863. He remained there until he was transferred to the smaller Knoxville Depot in December 1865.
